sen.j: 表右筆（おもてゆうひつ）は、江戸幕府に職制の1つ。
sen.e: Omote Yuhitsu was one of the office organisation of Edo bakufu.
Omote Yuhitsu was one of the office organizations of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: organisation→スペルミス、また文法上複数形が正しいためorganizationsに訂正しました。Edo bakufu→()内の説明を補足しました。
sen.e: Omote Yuhitsu was one of the office organizations of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 幕府の書記としての役目を務めた。
sen.e: They served as an amanuensis of bakufu.
They served as amanuenses of bakufu.
sen.cmt: an amanuensis→主語が複数のため複数形に訂正しました。
sen.e: They served as amanuenses of bakufu.

sen.j: 奥右筆とは対となる存在である。
sen.e: That was paired with Oku Yuchitsu.
That was paired with Oku Yuhitsu.
sen.cmt: Oku Yuchitsu→スペルミスのためOku Yuhitsuに訂正しました。
sen.e: That was paired with Oku Yuhitsu.

sen.j: 元々江戸幕府には右筆の職が存在して征夷大将軍の側近として御内書・奉書の執筆や法度浄書などを行い、また老中などの指示に従って公文書などの作成などを担当したが、徳川綱吉が将軍になると、館林藩時代の右筆を江戸城に連れてきて、従来の右筆に代わって自己の機密のことを関与させた。
sen.e: Originally in Edo bakufu, yuhitsu served as close adviser of Seii Taishogun writing gonaisho (a letter issued over the signature of the shogun), hosho (a document for informing lower-rank people of the decision of upper people such as an emperor or shogun), making a copy of hatto and preparing official documents by directions of roju, but when Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA became shogun, he bought yuhitsu of the time of Tatebayashi Domain to Edo-jo Castle and involved in his secrets instead of existing yuhitsu.

Originally in Edo bakufu, yuhitsu served as close adviser to Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") writing gonaisho (a letter issued over the signature of the shogun), hosho (a document for informing lower-rank people of the decision of upper people such as an emperor or shogun), making a fair copy of hatto (law) and preparing official documents under the orders of roju (member of shogun's council of elders), but when Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA became shogun, he brought yuhitsu of the time of Tatebayashi Domain to Edo-jo Castle and involved in his secrets instead of existing yuhitsu.
sen.cmt: adviser of→adviser toに訂正しました。（文法上）Seii Taishogun、hatto、roju→()内の説明を補足しました。copy→原文の意味に近いfair copyに訂正しました。by directions of→under the orders ofに訂正しました。（文法上）bought→スペルミスのためbroughtに訂正しました。
sen.e: Originally in Edo bakufu, yuhitsu served as close adviser to Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") writing gonaisho (a letter issued over the signature of the shogun), hosho (a document for informing lower-rank people of the decision of upper people such as an emperor or shogun), making a fair copy of hatto (law) and preparing official documents under the orders of roju (member of shogun's council of elders), but when Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA became shogun, he brought yuhitsu of the time of Tatebayashi Domain to Edo-jo Castle and involved in his secrets instead of existing yuhitsu.

sen.j: このため、従来の右筆は「表右筆」と呼ばれ、新しい右筆は「奥右筆」と呼ばれて職務が分割され、将軍身辺に関わる重要な職務は奥右筆の管轄となった。
sen.e: Therefore existing yuhitsu were called 'omote yuhitsu' and new yuhitsu were called 'oku yuhitsu' and they had different duties and the important duties around shogun were imposed to oku yuhitsu.
Therefore existing yuhitsu were called 'omote yuhitsu' and new yuhitsu were called 'oku yuhitsu' and they had different duties and the important duties around shogun were imposed on oku yuhitsu.
sen.cmt: ‘’→全角のため半角に訂正しました。imposed to→imposed onに訂正しました。（文法上）
sen.e: Therefore existing yuhitsu were called 'omote yuhitsu' and new yuhitsu were called 'oku yuhitsu' and they had different duties and the important duties around shogun were imposed on oku yuhitsu.

sen.j: その後、「奥右筆」に空席が出来た際には表右筆から後任を選ぶ慣例が成立して両者の職掌の棲み分けが図られるようになった。
sen.e: When 'oku yuhitsu' had vacant position, the successor was chosen from omote yuhitsu by convention and the official duties were divided.
After that, a practice was established in which the successor was chosen from omote yuhitsu when 'oku yuhitsu' had a vacant position, and the official duties began to be divided.
sen.cmt: 「その後、～ようになった」の原文に合うよう文体を訂正しました。‘→全角のため半角に訂正しました。vacant position→a vacant positionに訂正しました。（文法上）
sen.e: After that, a practice was established in which the successor was chosen from omote yuhitsu when 'oku yuhitsu' had a vacant position, and the official duties began to be divided.

sen.j: このため、表右筆は単なる幕府の書記役に過ぎなくなり、老中奉書や幕府日記、朱印状、判物の作成、幕府から全国に頒布する触書（約400枚前後）の浄書、大名の分限帳や旗本ら幕臣の名簿管理の業務に限定されるようになった。
sen.e: Therefore omote yuhitsu became just a amanuensis of bakufu and their duties were limited to make roju hosho, bakufu nikki. Shuinjyo, autographic signature and to make fair copy of furegaki (bakufu orders) (about 400 pieces) to distribute from bakufu across the country and to manage Bugencho (Registers of vassals) of daimyo and list of shogun's retainers such as hatamoto.

Therefore omote yuhitsu became just a amanuensis of bakufu and their duties began to be limited to make roju hosho, bakufu nikki (diary of bakufu), Shuinjyo (a vermillion seal letter), autographic signature and to make fair copy of furegaki (bakufu orders) (about 400 pieces) to distribute from bakufu across the country and to manage Bugencho (Registers of vassals) of daimyo (feudal lords) and list of shogun's retainers such as hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu).
sen.cmt: were limited→原文の「ようになった」に合うようbegan to be limitedに訂正しました。bakufu nikki.→ピリオドをコンマに訂正しました。bakufu nikki、Shuinjyo、daimyo、hatamoto→()内の説明を補足しました。
sen.e: Therefore omote yuhitsu became just a amanuensis of bakufu and their duties began to be limited to make roju hosho, bakufu nikki (diary of bakufu), Shuinjyo (a vermillion seal letter), autographic signature and to make fair copy of furegaki (bakufu orders) (about 400 pieces) to distribute from bakufu across the country and to manage Bugencho (Registers of vassals) of daimyo (feudal lords) and list of shogun's retainers such as hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu).

sen.j: 表右筆は定員2・3名の組頭（役高300俵）と30名前後の表右筆（役高150俵）から構成されていた。
sen.e: Omote yuhitsu were composed of 2 or 3 kumigashira (a head of the group) (300 bales salary) and about 30 omote yuhitsu (150 bales salary).

Omote yuhitsu were composed of 2 or 3 kumigashira (a head of the group) (300 bales of yakudaka [salary paid in accordance with the rank of one's post]) and about 30 omote yuhitsu (150 bales of yakudaka).
sen.cmt: 300 bales salary、150 bales salary→原文に合うよう訂正しました。
sen.e: Omote yuhitsu were composed of 2 or 3 kumigashira (a head of the group) (300 bales of yakudaka [salary paid in accordance with the rank of one's post]) and about 30 omote yuhitsu (150 bales of yakudaka).
